text: our goal and our vision is really one of
democratizing geospatial insights what
we're doing is we're combining three big
changes in the environment firstly the
emergence of very rich geospatial data
secondly the power of the cloud and you
know we're hosted on aws and lastly
there have been advances in
visualization and in ai building a
system that allows our customers to
solve problems that are essentially have
location as a central component but also
have visual information as yet another
key anchor point our customers face a
number of challenges on a day-to-day
basis if you look at utilities
vegetation encroachment is a key
challenge another major problem is
around the size and scale of assets aws
meets our needs for functionality but
also meets our needs for reliability
once we have the data through artificial
intelligence we pinpoint where the
issues are and then which issues are
most critical and now if you're a
utility with
a limited set of resources to do
inspection you can send people to where
the problems are and that in itself
drives huge cost savings efficiencies
and frankly better operations for our
customers we build on top of the aws
capability by firstly having a data lake
architecture that supports really large
unstructured data we then build
analytics which run on top of this
infrastructure so we find that we don't
have to reinvent the wheel that there is
this really nice building block that
exists on top of which we build our
offering which adds value for a very
specific domain which is the geospatial
domain
